III. METHODOLOGY
06/22/2020 Special Investigation Intake
2020C0214035
06/23/2020 Special Investigation Initiated - Face to Face interviews with
Resident A, Staff 1, and Administrator 1.
06/23/2020 Documents received – Facesheet, treatment plan,
policy/procedure, and personnel file.
06/23/2020 Inspection Completed On-site
07/28/2020 Inspection Completed-BCAL Sub. Compliance
ALLEGATION:
Staff member called resident the "B-Word" in response to resident's cursing at her.
INVESTIGATION:
I interviewed Resident A on 6/23/2020 at the facility. She reports that she first
called Staff 1 a “bitch” and Staff 1 responded by saying “don’t’ call me a bitch”. She
also reports there were no others present at this time and it occurred in the
kitchen/dining room area. She reported that she also threw food at Staff 1, hitting
her, and Staff 1 responded by grabbing her arm to make her stop. She reports that
she was angry because Staff 1 wanted her to slow down eating her snack. By her
report this occurred just prior to her calling Staff 1 a bitch. She ended by reporting
that she feels safe at the facility.
I interviewed Staff 1 on 6/23/2020 at the facility. She reports that both she and
Resident A were in the dining room playing cards when Resident A requested a
snack. She reports giving Resident A gram crackers for a snack. She reported that
Resident A was “shoving her gram crackers in her mouth and I feared that she
would choke”. Staff 1 reported that she said something to Resident A and Resident
A replied, “that’s why I don’t like you bitch”. Staff 1 stated, “I don’t remember what I
said to her, but she started turning over the chairs and table”. Staff 1 also stated, “I
could have said “don’t call me a bitch, but I don’t remember, and I am nervous”.

Staff 1 reported that using the word “bitch” would be inappropriate even if just saying
it for an example. She also reported that other staff came into the area and switched
out with her to help de-escalate Resident A. Staff 1 reported that she is trained to
respond in positive ways to residents no matter what they say to her.
I interviewed Administrator 1 on 6/23/2020 at the facility. She reports being
aware of the incident and that the interaction was caught on video tape. She also
reports that there is no audio with the video recording.
Documents reviewed:
I reviewed the incident report of the allegations. The incident report was written by a
staff who no longer works at the facility, who overhead Resident A sharing the
incident during a phone call. Documentation indicates that this staff spoke with
Resident A after the phone call to get clarifying information. The description of the
incident written closely matches the verbal reports of both Resident A and Staff 1.
Additional information in the incident report includes a statement by Resident A that
Staff 1 told her to “sit her little butt down before you get whooping you bitch”.
Resident A and Staff 1 never reported that this statement was made during the
interviews. The incident report is dated June 17, 2020.
I reviewed Resident A’s treatment plan. The goals for Resident A are to find
placement within 30-days. Her strengths and goals are identified. Issues involve
significant trauma, low IQ, and language impairments.
I reviewed the program’s procedure manual. Under the “prohibited practices” section
it is documented that “verbal abuse, ridicule or humiliation” are prohibited. The
document outlines the appropriate de-escalation techniques that staff are to use
which includes verbal communication in an effort to “maintain healthy
communication and reduce the likelihood of behaviors escalating”.
I reviewed Staff 1’s personnel file. There is documentation that Staff 1 has
completed the required training (over 90-hours in the past couple of years) and
received her annual evaluations. There is no evidence of any disciplinary action
taken with Staff 1.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these
administrative rules and in the agency's program statement and
to provide for the continual needs, protection, and supervision of
residents.

ANALYSIS: Evidence provided through interviews and written
documentation do support the allegations of staff not following
the facility policy/procedure when dealing with Resident A. By all
accounts, it appears that Staff 1 used profanity when addressing
Resident A who was struggling emotionally at the time. Resident
A struggles with trauma, has a low IQ, and language
impairments.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
This is a repeat violation from Special Investigation
2019C0223038 with an approved CAP on 6/28/19,
Special Investigation 2019C0214046 with an
approved CAP on 8/30/19, and Special Investigation
2019C0214023 with an approved CAP on 3/28/19
IV. RECOMMENDATION
With an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that no change be
made to the license of this child caring institution
